main event: A sighting of a brilliant light object flying parallel to the ground in Easton, Massachusetts, in August 1963.
interesting points: The object was described as having a red outer edge with a white center and a white tail about twice the size of the object., The sighting was noted around 10:25 p.m. on August 8, 1963., The witness claimed the object was very large, potentially 50 to 100 feet in diameter., Observations suggest the object did not match characteristics of known aircraft, being illuminated from within., Preliminary data implies the object could be a meteor, but no investigation was conducted.
witness description: Witnesses observed the object from a picnic and reported it moving at high speed, making circular movements.
